item.title: Open Data: Germany Maps Viz
item.description: In this post I want to show how to use public available (open) data to create geo visualizations in python. Maps are a great way to communicate and compare information when working with geolocation data. There are many frameworks to plot maps, here I focus on matplotlib and geopandas (and give a glimpse of mplleaflet). Reference: A very good introduction to matplotlib is the chapter on Visualization with Matplotlib from the Python Data Science Handbook by Jake VanderPlas.
